speaker: PASADENA, CALIFORNIA, 2
line: 45 AM

speaker: VOSBERG
line: It was on the call sheet for them to check in with us at midnight.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Did you try every band?

speaker: VOSBERG
line: Repeatedly. All audiovisuals seem to be down.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Maybe it's just a satellite glitch.

speaker: VOSBERG
line: We thought so, too, until we received this...... from a tracking station in Bend, Oregon. They picked it up about a half hour ago on an emergency frequency.

speaker: PIERCE
line: What are those guys doing?

speaker: VOSBERG
line: We did manage to uplink Firewalker's video camera. It's at base camp, so we're hoping it can, uh, give us a picture, tell us what's going on there.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Data feed's coming in now.

speaker: PIERCE
line: What's the robot doing in the volcano?

speaker: VOSBERG
line: I don't know. There's no descent scheduled.

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Firewalker's not responding. Except for the video feed, I can't get control. Someone's overriding it.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Lock camera remote and pan left.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Stop. Stop. Go back. Tilt up and zoom in.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Erikson.

speaker: VOSBERG
line: What the hell?

speaker: PIERCE
line: Give me that.

speaker: VOSBERG
line: There it is again. Did you see that? You saw that shadow, didn't you?

speaker: TECHNICIAN
line: Yeah, but what could be moving around in that kind of heat?

speaker: VOSBERG
line: I don't know, maybe it was, uh, just a ghost signal. It wouldn't be the first time.

speaker: VOSBERG
line: What's going on up there?

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: Let's go now to our science editor, Eric Parker, standing by in Mount Avalon, Washington. Eric?

speaker: NEWS REPORTER
line: I'm standing here on an historic eve, with a group of scientists who can barely contain their excitement about this device, which looks like a large titanium bug. Its name is Firewalker, and next week will make its first descent into an active volcano. Now this amazing robot is the brainchild of vulcanologist Daniel Trepkos, whose objective is to gather samples from the crater floor which may hold valuable scientific data about the earth's core.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Scientific data? We're talking about revisiting the very origin of the earth, peering into the fire where it all began - a human endeavor more important even than man's exploration of space.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's no mean claim.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Daniel always had a flair for self-dramatization.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd always heard that he was brilliant.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Brilliant doesn't go quite far enough. Daniel occupies that rare place among scientists where dreams, ambition and great luck converge.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you think his luck just ran out?

speaker: PIERCE
line: The team of scientists you just saw sent a distress signal yesterday after failing to make a scheduled status report, and they haven't responded to any of our calls. But by using remote telemetry, we were able to activate Firewalker's camera. This is what we found.

speaker: PIERCE
line: You're looking at the floor of the volcano. But this is the last thing we expected to discover. The dead man is, uh, Phil Erikson, chief seismologist. Now, look at this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoa! What the hell is that?

speaker: PIERCE
line: We don't know. Whatever it was disabled the camera. The temperature readings are upwards of 130 degrees at this depth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But that was alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why weren't you up there?

speaker: PIERCE
line: I left the project six weeks ago. Trepkos and I nearly came to blows.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Over what?

speaker: PIERCE
line: I wish I could explain. Daniel and I, uh... I always played Salieri to his Mozart. I was never quite on his plane of intellect, but this time I found him slipping into madness, the way he began to control the others.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think he's responsible for what happened?

speaker: PIERCE
line: Whatever there is between me and Trepkos, I pray that he isn't. We've got 20 million tax dollars in this project. If word of it were to get out, it could destroy years of work. I'm afraid to go through proper channels.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're not exactly proper channels.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How soon can we get up there?

speaker: PIERCE
line: Well, we've got a charter flight waiting to take us to Seattle. From there, a helicopter will fly us to Mount Avalon.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? I don't think it's a good idea for you to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I appreciate your concern - but I'm ready. I want to work.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe you should take some time off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've already lost too much time.

speaker: PIERCE
line: There it is!

speaker: PIERCE
line: This was Firewalker's satellite relay. We installed field instruments all around this area - seismographs, tiltmeters...

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll look around out here after we've checked inside.

speaker: PIERCE
line: These instruments are worth millions of project dollars, and I'm accountable to the USGS for every one of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shouldn't we find the rest of the descent team first?

speaker: PIERCE
line: I just want to take a quick damage survey. I'll catch up with you in a few minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like somebody wanted to put this operation permanently out of commission.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Wait! Wait!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Hey, this isn't what it looks like!

speaker: MULDER
line: He just about took my head off!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: I told you I made a mistake, OK? I'm sorry, all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, who the hell are you?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: I'm Ludwig. I'm Jason Ludwig. I'm the robotics engineer for the descent team.

speaker: MULDER
line: You always greet people this way?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: I heard a noise, OK, I thought it was him. I was just trying to protect myself. You know, self-preservation?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, who did you think I was that you thought you had to protect yourself?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Trepkos.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: He ran hot and cold, you know? Sometimes he wouldn't talk to us for days, and then - boom - you couldn't get him to shut up. Don't get me wrong, OK? No one revered the man more than me. I mean, he was a prophet, an oracle. He saw things... I mean, he saw things that you and me, we only dream about and then forget when we wake up.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Oh, it's OK, you can come out now, the cavalry's here.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: This is Peter Tanaka, our systems analyst. And, uh, this is Jesse O'Neil.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Are you the rescue team?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, we're with the FBI.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: The FBI? But you're taking us back, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: After we've investigated what happened here.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Trepkos is what happened here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he kill Erikson?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: He flipped out. Right after the descent, he just flipped out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you think of anything that might have caused or contributed to his behavior?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: You're asking me?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Daniel is sick. He had a bi-polar disorder, I think that's what it was. It wasn't a secret, but not something he advertised either. But with his medication, he was just fine.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah, well I think Erikson's wife might disagree with that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're part of the team, Jesse?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Daniel was my thesis adviser at the university. He asked me to assist him on this project.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are these his notes?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Oh, yeah, well whatever is left of them. First thing he did was destroy all his own work - you know, his field journals, his computer disks. We salvaged what we could, but I don't really think you'll find much in there... of use, anyway.

speaker: PIERCE
line: Hello? Anyone there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? What do you make of Mr. Trepkos' neighborhood?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't you think their behavior is a little bizarre, almost paranoid?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, considering what they've been through, not especially.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're practically climbing the walls in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they've been living in the middle of nowhere for almost a year. One of their team members is dead, probably at the hands of another. You have to expect some heightened level of emotional distress.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, there's more than that... something they're not telling us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Based on what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Based on when Ludwig tried to play tee-ball with my head. He knew I wasn't Trepkos.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now, Mulder, you're sounding paranoid.

speaker: MULDER
line: Pierce knows these people. Let's find out what he thinks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: No one can leave.

speaker: VARIOUS
line: Pierce... Pierce... He's not here... Pierce... Can you hear me?... Something's happened to him... Pierce... I'll check the landing site...

speaker: TANAKA
line: Oh, my God. Get over here! He's over here! I found him! I found him! I found him!

speaker: SCULLY
line: That should do it.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: What should we do with the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have a freezer?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah, I'll take it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't you radio for the helicopter, I'm almost done here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me help you.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: That's OK, we got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: We can't leave, Scully. Not yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: Trepkos is still out there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. He killed Pierce and probably Erikson. I think we should come back for him with a larger party.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been going over Trepkos' work, fragments mostly but I found several references to a subterranean organism.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: An unknown organism, existing within the volcano. I haven't found anything yet that describes it in specific terms but...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, nothing can live in a volcanic interior, not only because of the intense heat but the gases would be toxic to any organism.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does this say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It describes the metabolism from hydrogen sulfide into silicon dioxide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doesn't that suggest a silicon-based life form?

speaker: SCULLY
line: But the fundamental building block for every organism known to man is carbon, from the smallest bacterium to the largest redwood tree.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, but silicon is the closest element to carbon. It reacts almost identically with other elements, the way it combines to form complex molecules. A silicon-based lifeform in the deep biosphere has been one of the Holy Grails of modern science and maybe Trepkos found it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that is science fiction. It's, it's an elaborate construct from a delusional mind. This doesn't prove anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Trepkos said he had physical evidence. It's got to be around here somewhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever evidence Trepkos had, he destroyed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe it wasn't Trepkos who destroyed it. What if it was one of the others?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why on earth would they do that? But, Mulder, the fact is that all of these people are suffering to varying degrees from post-traumatic stress, and from a strictly medical point of view, we have to get them out of here sooner rather than later.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jesse? Can I talk to you? Are you OK?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: I hate this place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened here, Jesse? You can trust me.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: After the first descent, Daniel changed. He became withdrawn and paranoid. He locked himself in the lab for three days and wouldn't let any of us in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you think the descent somehow triggered his breakdown?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Well, that's what I thought. And then...... I found out he stopped taking his pills.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lithium carbonate.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Yeah, he said that they were polluting his brain. And he said I was polluting his body. I'm scared. I don't want to die here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you so afraid of, Jesse?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Daniel. The only reason I even came here was because of him. He promised me that this would be an adventure... and that it would change my life. But eight months is a long time, and I just want to go home now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is home?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Anywhere but here.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Samples 7, 12 and 22 also contain trace evidence of the organism. The possiblity of this new, or perhaps unfathomably old, life form has left me sleepless, wondering if I haven't lost all perspective... if my intense desire to find the truth hasn't finally eclipsed the truth itself. Our meddling intellect misshapes the beauteous forms of things we murder to dissect. My mind is a tangled knot I can no longer untie. Daily I fight the urge to sever it completely, to stop this descent...

speaker: MULDER
line: What caused that tremor?

speaker: TANAKA
line: There's been a lot of seismic activity lately on the northeast rift zone.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah, if Trepkos hadn't destroyed all our instruments, we might even have learned something from it.

speaker: MULDER
line: You feeling all right?

speaker: TANAKA
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, Agent Scully is a medical doctor. You should let her take a look at you.

speaker: TANAKA
line: I'm fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you just let her take a look...

speaker: TANAKA
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll go get Scully.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Come on, get up. She'll help you.

speaker: TANAKA
line: I don't want her to help me.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Of course you do. It's for the best. We have to get out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: He just collapsed after the tremor. He seems pretty bad.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: He's burning up.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't tell whether it's an infection or a toxic reaction, but we've got to get him to a hospital.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: I'll get a stretcher.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Trepkos? We can't just leave him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give me the short wave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Agent Scully with the Firewalker team. Come in, Search and Rescue.

speaker: MULDER
line: Got him?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You guys go ahead. I'll get O'Neil and meet you at the landing site.

speaker: RADIO
line: This is Search and Rescue, over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Request dispatch of Med-Evac to our location immediately. We have an asian male, mid-thirties, spiking a high-grade fever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tanaka's collapsed. We're getting him out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tanaka!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Peter! Peter, come on, get back here!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: There!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Come on!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't go down there!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Let me go! What are you doing? Let, let go of me!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't go down there!

speaker: LUDWIG
line: For God's sake, what are you doing? He needs our help!

speaker: MULDER
line: So what is it, Scully? What are we dealing with?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Without better imaging equipment, I can't say for sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll take any theory you've got.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It appears to be some kind of a fungus.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything you recognize?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm not a botanist, but I think it's fair to guess that it's an unknown genus.

speaker: MULDER
line: What am I looking at here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Spores. I scraped them off the tip of the fungus. It appears as if one of the spores grew inside of Tanaka until it reached reproductive maturity... essentially outgrowing its host. But by then, it had already caused massive tissue damage, particularly to the respiratory tract.

speaker: MULDER
line: That would account for the sand in his lungs.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: You found sand in his lungs?

speaker: MULDER
line: Silicon dioxide, the waste product of a silicon-based organism.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Wait a second, there's no such thing as a silicon-based organism.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe now there is, but we won't have conclusive proof until we determine its molecular structure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully, how else do you explain the sand in his lungs - the best trace evidence we could ask for. Trepkos was right.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Daniel knew about this?

speaker: MULDER
line: He discovered the spore in the samples Firewalker brought up.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: He would have told us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not if what he discovered was too disturbing even for him to understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This might explain something else, though. The spore could explain Trepkos' dementia. Fungi often contain alkaloids that can affect the nervous system.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah, but what about us? I mean, we weren't exposed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We don't know that. If it was an airborne microbe, any of us could have inhaled the spore.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: So we're not going home, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not until we know how it's transmitted, how it incubates. If even one of us is infected, we could risk infecting a much larger population.

speaker: MULDER
line: Search and Rescue, this is Agent Mulder. Do you copy?

speaker: RADIO
line: Yeah, this is Search and Rescue. We're still in a holding pattern, over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Please notify FBI District Headquarters in Spokane that our party is quarantining itself due to possible contagion. Have CDC set up an evacuation unit on high alert.

speaker: RADIO
line: What's the nature of the contagion? Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell them it's a biological agent... of unknown origin.

speaker: RADIO
line: That's affirmative. Standing by...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you should go check up on O'Neil.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to go find Trepkos.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if he's already dead?

speaker: MULDER
line: Then he'll have a tough time answering my questions. I've got to find out what he knows. What he's found could change everything we understand about the origin and evolution of life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's dangerous, Mulder. He's already killed two men.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then I have to find out why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Will you at least let me go with you?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I know what you're thinking but you have to get past that. We both do. I'm back, and I'm not going anywhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have to finish the autopsy on Tanaka. Hopefully, that will give us a better idea of what we're dealing with, whatever it is. I'm counting on you to keep us all from ending up on that slab.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Do like we said, OK.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Uh-huh. You know what to say, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: I could use a little help.

speaker: O'NEIL
line: Excuse me.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: So what do you need?

speaker: MULDER
line: Directions, contour map, USGS survey, anything that can help me get here.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Oh. These are the steam caves. They feed into the Sherman Crater. That's how we access the caldera. How did you get these?

speaker: MULDER
line: Firewalker. They were transmitted right before Trepkos destroyed its camera.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Oh. So you're finally going to go after Trepkos. Well, I tell you one thing. You won't find him with those. And you won't find him with any map either.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, how will I find them?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: You won't. Not without a guide.

speaker: MULDER
line: A guide.

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Yeah, a guide. Look, I've been up here for almost a year. I spent months in those caves, charting every fissure, every crevice, so Firewalker wouldn't trip. If Trepkos is there, I can find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, why are you so eager to help me find him?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Oh, I'm, I'm not eager. I just don't feel like waiting around for Trepkos to do to me what he did to Pierce and Erikson. Plus you've got the gun. You're the only one who can get us out of this place.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever I'm smelling, is it toxic?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: Between the heat and the sulfur, it can get pretty nasty in here, but it won't hurt you. You'll get used to it.

speaker: MULDER
line: How far does the cave extend?

speaker: LUDWIG
line: About three quarters of a mile to the crater rim. Let's head in. It twists around quite a bit until you get there. Lots of dead ends and blind drops and unless you know where you're going, you're like a rat in a maze.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Your gun. Back. Get back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you doing this, Trepkos? He's already dead. How many times do you have to kill him?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: It's not him I'm trying to kill.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have attempted to culture the spore using temperatures ranging from human basal to those approximating the volcanic interior. I've used nutritive mediums, containing human tissue, blood and saliva, even sulfur. However, none of the seven trials have successfully grown the fungus that killed Tanaka. Based on this preliminary ingested or inhaled by the host organism immediately upon their release, they become harmless... effectively dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jesse?

speaker: O'NEIL
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you might like to know, chances are good that none of us were infected. We were at a safe distance from Tanaka when the spores scattered, and as soon as Mulder and Ludwig come back we can leave. I, I just need to run a few more tests but I think we're going to be OK.

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK, Jesse? Jesse?

speaker: MULDER
line: What went wrong, Trepkos? Firewalker carried something back to the surface.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Firewalker brought up an elephant. The truth is an elephant described by three blind men. The first man touches the tail and says it's a rope. The second man feels the rough leg and says it's a tree. The third man feels the trunk and says it's a snake.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about you? What do you say it is?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: I say the earth holds some truths best left buried.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like the spore?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Who are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Special Agent Mulder. I'm with the FBI.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: You don't look like a policeman.

speaker: MULDER
line: I came down here to investigate Erikson's death.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: That's not why you're here. You still believe you can petition heaven and get some penetrating answer. If you found that answer, what would you do with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I just want to know what happened after the first descent. What did you find?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: It was porous. Obsidian. Erikson thought it was some sort of rock, so I told him to pulverize it for analysis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Erikson released the spore?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: He discovered a new life form. In a single moment, everything that science held sacred suddenly turned on its head.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Erikson? If he was infected...

speaker: TREPKOS
line: I was too immersed in the work to notice. I'd been alone in the lab for three days when I heard their screams. They were all gathered around him. By the time I realized what was happening, they were already changing. The spore grew in each of them until it became them.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: It's a parasite. It lives to find a host.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you weren't infected?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: You destroyed your work, the transmitting equipment, you killed Pierce so no one could leave.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: No one can leave.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about O'Neil?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: Jesse?

speaker: MULDER
line: Was she exposed to the spore?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: They were all exposed. All of them.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a colleague - a friend - who's with O'Neil right now. Let me go to her.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: She may already be infected.

speaker: TREPKOS
line: I can't let you leave.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you're going to have to shoot me. Because I'm walking out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jesse?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh! God, you scared me! Jesse? Are you OK? Jesse, what's wrong? Jesse?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jesse, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm OK, I'm OK.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm OK.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look. She was infected. I don't know how.

speaker: MULDER
line: Erikson was the original host. When the fungus shed its spores, everyone was at ground zero except for Trepkos.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you find him?

speaker: TREPKOS
line: I told her it would change her life.

speaker: MULDER
line: Search and Rescue, this is Agent Mulder. Do you copy?

speaker: RADIO
line: This is Army Biohazard. How many are in your party?

speaker: MULDER
line: We have two survivors, Agent Scully and myself.

speaker: RADIO
line: Copy that. Our ETA is seven minutes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing? They're going to want to question him.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's all over, Scully. He won't talk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully and I are in the third day of a month-long quarantine, undergoing level 4 decon procedures. We are so far without symptoms of fungal contamination. All our specimens and field notes were confiscated by the military biohazard corps prior to our evacuation. Their presence has delayed for an indefinite period the arrival of the USGS data retrieval team. I suspect, though, that there will be little left for them to retrieve. There are no plans at present to explore further any of the hundreds of volcanically active mountains in the Cascade Range, including Mount Avalon. All access points to that volcano have been sealed off by army engineers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Of the members of the Firewalker descent team, only Trepkos and O'Neil remain unaccounted for. They are presumed dead, and the search for them has been abandoned. Firewalker, however, was recovered, though its sensory and locomotive systems were found to be irreparably damaged. The data it collected from the earth's interior will never be known. And of the events that occurred at Mount Avalon between the 11th and 13th of November, 1994, mine stands as the only record.
